On this page, you will find information about working at ArtLifting as well as postings for open positions.


Subscribe to our newsletter and follow ArtLifting on LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook  to stay up to date on job opportunities.

Content and Marketing Coordinator
  • Apply here by July 15, 2025 (updated due to volume of applicants)
  • Download the Full Job Description

We're seeking a strategic and creative Content & Marketing Coordinator to join our marketing team. Reporting to the Director of Marketing, you'll drive content creation and storytelling initiatives that elevate ArtLifting’s brand, artists, and mission. This role focuses on developing B2B marketing strategies, collaborating with artists and clients, and leveraging AI tools and video to scale impact and visibility.

Associate Curator
  • Apply here by October 22, 2025 - Posting may close early due to volume. We recommend applying as soon as possible. If the application form is active, the posting is open.
  • Download the Full Job Description

We’re seeking a creative and detail-oriented Associate Curator to join our curation team. Reporting to the Head Curator, you’ll craft custom artwork proposals and design mock-ups for corporate clients, blending art, design, and technology to transform spaces. This role is ideal for someone who combines aesthetic expertise with digital fluency—leveraging Adobe Creative Suite, Google Slides, and AI tools to curate meaningful, mission-driven art experiences.

Please note: We use a Google Form to collect applications. If you are having trouble accessing the form, please ensure your browser is updated, clear your cookies and cache, or try a different browser. If you're still having trouble, please contact hr@artlifting.com.

Art Advisor (2 Openings)

  • Apply here - Open until filled. If the application form is active, the posting is open.
  • Download the Full Job Description

We’re seeking driven and relationship-focused Art Advisors to join our sales team. Reporting to the Senior Director of Sales, you’ll leverage your industry network and enterprise sales expertise to connect socially conscious organizations with artwork by artists with disabilities. In this role, you’ll lead strategic account growth from prospecting through renewal — crafting solutions that deliver measurable business value and amplify artist impact. You’ll thrive on building trust with diverse stakeholders, closing complex multi-year deals, and championing ArtLifting’s mission.

Please note: We use a Google Form to collect applications. If you are having trouble accessing the form, please ensure your browser is updated, clear your cookies and cache, or try a different browser. If you're still having trouble, please contact hr@artlifting.com.

ArtLifting is a social enterprise championing artists with disabilities. As a for-profit, for-purpose company and a public benefit corporation, we believe in the business for good model: 

  • Artists earn 55% of the profit from the sale of their work
  • 1% from each sale goes to a fund which provides art supplies to art groups nationwide
  • ArtLifting uses the remaining 44% to further our mission

Building and Supporting a Diverse Team


The business for good philosophy applies to how ArtLifting operates as an employer. The ArtLifting team includes incredible and talented team members who work together to make ArtLifting a rewarding and inclusive place to work.


ArtLifting values employees with different identities and life experiences. People of any background, age, and ability are highly encouraged to apply for open positions. ArtLifting seeks individuals to join our team who are aligned with our company values:

  • Create Opportunity
  • Spark Creativity
  • Deliver Value
  • Act with Purpose
  • Learn Always


ArtLifting is a woman-founded and woman-owned company with a majority of board members identifying as women. ArtLifting leadership is committed to building and supporting a diverse team through:

  • Inclusive hiring practices to hire the best candidates including: no degree requirements for any roles, no cover letter required, incorporating gender neutral language into policies and job descriptions, internal bias training for hiring committees, dedicated outreach to communities of color and disability job boards, and standardizing job offer practices
  • People-first approaches to culture and policies to support a diverse team including: forming a Culture Squad to activate team building and learning, hosting a bi-weekly Meet the Artist session to connect directly with ArtLifting artists, dedicating funds to every team member's professional development
  • Intentional and equitable approach to artist recruitment and client artwork recommendations to eliminate bias

Total Rewards Package


ArtLifting offers competitive pay and benefits to team members and is committed to equity, trust, and transparency in our total rewards practices, which include compensation, benefits, and employee wellness policies.


Compensation at ArtLifting consists of base pay, variable pay, and equity via stock options. 

  • ArtLifting has a transparent and competitive compensation policy that enables systematic and equitable decision-making around employee pay. 
  • ArtLifting shares the following information with all employees:
       -Total Rewards Philosophy
       -Pay ranges for all job levels
       -Benchmark job descriptions for all jobs that we benchmark
       -Benchmark market data for all jobs that we benchmark 


ArtLifting benefits package includes:

  • Generous and flexible time off: 4 weeks of paid vacation annually, paid sick time, and 13 paid company holidays each year
  • Paid parental leave for all parents:12 weeks for birth, adoption, and foster care
  • Remote-first organization: work from anywhere in the U.S.
  • 401(k) plan with up to 6% employer matching
  • Healthcare reimbursement for medical and dental insurance and qualified expenses


ArtLifting proudly launched a 4-day (32-hour) work week in 2023 in order to further our commitment to building an equitable, accessible, and productive work environment.

We believe balance, flexibility, and time to rest is important for happiness and wellness. 

Our 32-hour, 4-day work week and work from anywhere policy offers accessible work opportunities for people of all abilities.

Predictable time away from work with Recharge Fridays helps ensure employees take time to rest and encourages a healthy work-life balance.


ArtLifting Artists Applying to Work at ArtLifting


We welcome ArtLifting Artists who have applied for representation or are currently represented by ArtLifting to apply for any open position at ArtLifting. If you are a current or prospective artist looking to apply for an open position, please email hr@artlifting.com for more information about policies regarding artist representation and employment.


Questions


If you have any questions about the information above, our job openings, or working at ArtLifting, please feel free to contact us at hr@artlifting.com.

You can also view more information about ArtLifting on our FAQ page and About page.
Subscribe to the ArtLifting newsletter to learn about job opportunities, design tips, and meet artists.
